alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 1:09AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 100 AM MDT... At 1209 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rushville to 27 miles north of Ashby. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton, Big Hill, Morgan Lake, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Rock Hill and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 84 and 112. Highway 250 between mile markers 39 and 48. Highway 61 between mile markers 193 and 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
